availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. James (Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married Catharine W. Alexander James on September 6, 1843. Father of Benjamin W. James, Martha E. James, Horace James, David P. James, John T. James, Joseph R. James, Sally C. James, Mary F. James, Agnus James, Jennetta James, and Cordelia James. Carpenter in Wilson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wilson County, District 1, p. 313; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 13; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Court House Precinct 3, p. 9; Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Wilson County, 1843, Microfilm, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville; Find A Grave, "Wm H. James (1823-1889)," Memorial #145617366, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=145617366 (accessed May 29, 2017).
